head.title: An Even Closer Encounter With Eros

hedline.hl1: An Even Closer Encounter With Eros

abstract.p: Tiny asteroid Eros is photographed from distance of only 3.7 miles by NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft, which arrived at asteroid for yearlong study last February; photo (S)

block.p: The tiny asteroid Eros was photographed from a distance of only 3.7 miles last week by the NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft, which arrived at the asteroid for a yearlong study last February. Eros, the largest of the near-Earth asteroids, is the smallest body ever orbited by a spacecraft. The pictures, showing rocks as small as a bathtub, reveal a primitive body, its chemistry apparently unchanged since the birth of the solar system, but whose surface has been battered and crumbled to deep dust by billions of years of bombardment.
